intents.reply: You can use this app to build teams, compare analyses, and simulate matches. Try: Dashboard for navigation, Team Selector to browse teams/players, Build Team to create a lineup, and Build Match to compare two teams/formations.
To predict a match: open Build Match, pick Team A and Team B, choose formations, set playing XI and ratings, then run prediction. The backend combines multiple models to estimate a winner.
For lineups: choose a formation (e.g., 4-3-3, 4-2-3-1), then assign players to positions on the pitch. Balanced teams usually mix strong defense, midfield control, and pace up front.
There isn't one best formation. 4-3-3 helps pressing and wide attacks, 4-2-3-1 is balanced, and 3-5-2 can dominate midfield if your wing-backs are strong. The best choice depends on your players.
High pressing works best with a compact team, fast defenders, and hard-working forwards. If you get bypassed often, drop the line slightly and keep midfielders closer together.
Counter-attacks usually work best with quick forwards, direct passing, and a compact defensive block. Win the ball, play forward early, and attack space behind the defense.
